title: Bank of Mexico Lowers Economic Growth Forecasts
sub_head: The central bank sees GDP expanding 2.2% in 2022 and 2.4% in 2023
body:
MEXICO CITYâ€”The Bank of Mexico cut its economic growth estimates for this year and 2023, citing persistent supply-chain disruptions and higher inflation leading to a lower global growth outlook.
In its quarterly report, the central bank said Wednesday that it expects gross domestic product to expand 2.2% in 2022, down from its previous estimate of 2.4%, while lowering the 2023 forecast to 2.4% from 2.9% previously.
